translation: nagle, szorstko [in a sudden, unexpected, and sometimes unpleasant way]
sentence: The talks ended abruptly when one of the delegations walked out in protest.

translation: nadejście, pojawienie się [the fact of an event happening, an invention being made, or a person arriving]
sentence: Life was transformed by the advent of the steam engine.

translation: przypadłość, nieszczęście [something that makes you suffer]
sentence: Malnutrition is one of the common afflictions of the poor.

translation: płonący, w płomieniach
sentence: The rioters overturned several cars and set them alight.

translation: czar, wspaniałość [the quality of being attractive, interesting, or exciting]
sentence: The allure of the stage drew him back to acting.

translation: antyk, starożytność [the distant past, especially before the sixth century]
sentence: Cannabis has been used for medicinal purposes since antiquity.

translation: jesion
sentence: It would be absurd to enact that a proprietor should not cut down an ash tree or a tree of any kind.

translation: nieśmiałość
sentence: Their son was well behaved, but his bashfulness worried his parents.

translation: paciorkowaty, świdrujący (wzrok) [(of eyes) small, round, and bright; watching everything closely or with suspicion]
sentence: I could just see the bird's open beak and small beady eyes.

translation: rozkaz, żądanie
sentence: Congress adopted the budget resolution at the behest of the president.

translation: trybuny [a sloping area of seats at a sports field that are not covered and are therefore not expensive to sit in]
sentence: During the first season after these events, expressions of national protest were extremely rare on the soccer bleachers.

translation: biust [a woman's breasts]
sentence: She pressed him to her bosom.

translation: rozbójnik [a thief with a weapon, especially one of a group living in the countryside and stealing from people travelling through the area]
sentence: An example of brigand is a robber who steals from campers out for a hike.

translation: przywzoitka [an older person, especially a woman, who stays with and takes care of a younger woman who is not married when she is in public]
sentence: She asked me to go to the cinema with her and Andrew, I think as a sort of chaperone.

translation: domagać się [to make a loud complaint or demand]
sentence: Everyone was clamoring to know how much they would get.

translation: prześwit [the amount of space or distance that is needed between two objects so that they do not touch each other]
sentence: There is not much clearance for vehicles passing under this bridge.

translation: koło zębate
sentence: Every member of the family is a vital cog in research.

translation: okrężnica
sentence: Colorectal cancer is a malignant tumor arising from the inner wall of the colon or rectum.

translation: łączyć, połączyć [to put two or more things together to make one new thing]
sentence: She conflated the three plays to produce a fresh new work.

translation: wyczarować [to make something appear by magic, or as if by magic]
sentence: He could conjure coins from behind people's ears.

translation: nabawić się, zachorować [formal; to catch or become ill with a disease]
sentence: He contracted malaria while he was travelling.

translation: zbierać się [formal; to bring together a group of people for a meeting, or to meet for a meeting]
sentence: The council will be convening on the morning of the 25th.

translation: serdeczny
sentence: Relations between the two leaders are said to be cordial.

translation: następstwo [something that results from something else]
sentence: Unfortunately, violence is the inevitable corollary of such a revolutionary change in society.

translation: oszukać, ocyganić [to get money from someone in a way that is not honest]
sentence: He diddled me! He said that there were six in a bag, but there were only five.

translation: wypierać, wysiedlać [to force something out of its usual or original position; to force someone to leave their home]
sentence: The building of a new dam will displace thousands of people who live in this area.

translation: wróżbiarstwo [the skill or act of saying or discovering what will happen in the future]
sentence: Cardano had little patience for the prevailing divination methods of the day, like astrology.

translation: kanał [a tube or pipe that carries liquid or air, especially in and out of buildings or through the body]
sentence: Most office buildings have dozens of air ducts and vents.

translation: przymus [threats used to force a person to do something]
sentence: He claimed that he signed the confession under duress.

translation: kościelny [formal; belonging to or connected with the Christian religion]
sentence: It was regarded as a model of ecclesiastical, patriotic eloquence.

translation: uprawniony do [having the necessary qualities or satisfying the necessary conditions]
sentence: Are you eligible for early retirement leave?

translation: emanować, wydzielać [formal; to express a quality or feeling through the way that you look and behave]
sentence: Her face emanated sadness.

translation: pochłaniać, ogarniać [to surround and cover something or someone completely]
sentence: The flames rapidly engulfed the house.

translation: pociągać za sobą [formal]
sentence: Such a large investment inevitably entails some risk.

translation: unikać, uchylać się [to avoid or escape from someone or something]
sentence: She leaned forward to kiss him but he evaded her by pretending to sneeze.

translation: zaostrzyć [to make something worse, especially a disease or problem]
sentence: This attack will exacerbate the already tense relations between the two communities.

translation: oczyszczenie, uniewinnienie [formal; the act of showing or stating that someone or something is not guilty of something]
sentence: The investigation ended with his exoneration.

translation: przyspieszać (coś), szybko załatwiać [formal; to make something happen more quickly]
sentence: Something needs to be done to expedite the process.

translation: zagłodzony [informal; extremely hungry]
sentence: Have some dinner with us - you must be famished!

translation: anemiczny, słaby [weak and without energy, strength, or power]
sentence: He was a feeble, helpless old man.

translation: myszkować [informal; to search for something by moving things around with your hands, especially in a drawer, bag, or other closed space]
sentence: I was just ferreting around in my drawer for my passport.

translation: cuchnący [formal; smelling extremely bad and stale]
sentence: People languish in fetid prisons around the world; those people seek asylum and safety.

translation: kra [a large area of ice floating in the sea]
sentence: The party therefore camped on the drifting floe, keeping up scientific observations and maintaining their health and spirits.

translation: podżegać [formal]
sentence: The song was banned on the grounds that it might foment racial tension.

translation: przygoda [a short period of time being involved in an activity that is different from and outside the range of a usual set of activities]
sentence: She made a brief foray into acting before becoming a teacher.

translation: zapobiegać [to prevent something from happening by acting first]
sentence: Try to anticipate what your child will do and forestall problems.

translation: tracić [to lose the right to do or have something because you have broken a rule]
sentence: If you cancel now, you forfeit your deposit.

translation: obżarstwo
sentence: They treat christmas as just another excuse for gluttony.

translation: okazałość, wspaniałość [the quality of being very large and special or beautiful]
sentence: We were struck by the silent grandeur of the desert.

translation: spłukany [infomal]
sentence: We're a bit hard-up at the moment so we're not thinking about holidays.

translation: dziedziczny
sentence: It is a hereditary title, so Mark Howard will become Sir Mark Howard on his father's death.

translation: rąbać, ciosać [to cut a large piece out of wood, coal, rock, stone, or another hard material in a rough way]
sentence: The monument was hewn out of the side of a mountain.

translation: nieprzejezdny [(of a road, an area, etc.) impossible to travel on or through, especially because it is in bad condition or it has been blocked by something]
sentence: The mountain roads are totally impassable to cars in winter.

translation: niedostrzegalny
sentence: She heard a faint, almost imperceptible cry.

translation: nienasycony [(especially of a desire or need) too great to be satisfied]
sentence: Nothing, it seemed, would satisfy his insatiable curiosity.

translation: bezczelny
sentence: Students were often inattentive, sometimes even insolent, and showed relatively little interest in their work.

translation: żart [formal; something that is said or done in order to be funny]
sentence: His proposal was no jest - he was completely sincere.

translation: senior, feudał [old use; a lord or king]
sentence: No man would break an oath to his liege.

translation: nizina [flat land that is at, or not much higher than, sea level]
sentence: From the lowlands of the south to the rugged peaks in the north, this area has something for everyone.

translation: markotny [unhappy, annoyed, and unwilling to speak or smile]
sentence: Why are you so morose these days?

translation: rabunek [an act of attacking someone and stealing their money]
sentence: Police are concerned that mugging is on the increase.

translation: nic (lub: cyfra zero)
sentence: Add two naughts and divide by two. All our efforts were for naught.

translation: jajnik [either of the pair of organs in a woman's body that produce eggs, or the part of any female animal or plant that produces eggs or seeds]
sentence: Only the left ovary becomes functional, with rare individual exceptions.

translation: przypowieść [a short, simple story that teaches or explains an idea, especially a moral or religious idea]
sentence: The parable of the three rings is the epitome of the pragmatic position.

translation: mowa [a group of words or style of speaking used by a particular group of people]
sentence: I couldn't understand their legal parlance.

translation: stukot (lub: trajkotanie, paplanina) [the sound of a lot of things gently and repeatedly hitting a surface; fast, continuous talk, esp. that of an entertainer or someone trying to sell things]
sentence: I find the patter of rain on the roof soothing. Philip’s clever patter kept his audience in a good mood.

translation: czytać uważnie [formal; to read through something, especially in order to find the part you are interested in]
sentence: He opened a newspaper and began to peruse the personal ads.

translation: malowniczy [(especially of a place) attractive in appearance, especially in an old-fashioned way]
sentence: We strolled through the picturesque streets of the old city.

translation: szczyt [the most successful or admired part of a system or achievement]
sentence: By the age of 32 she had reached the pinnacle of her career.

translation: orać
sentence: We're going to plough the top field next week.

translation: proteza [an artificial body part, such as an arm, foot, or tooth, that replaces a missing part]
sentence: She was fitted with a prosthesis to replace her missing leg.

translation: rozterka, dylemat, kłopot [a state of not being able to decide what to do about a situation in which you are involved]
sentence: We're in a quandary over which school to send her to.

translation: krokiew [any of the large, sloping pieces of wood that support a roof]
sentence: This is then affixed to the end of the rafter in the middle of the front of the stage.

translation: obopólność [behavior in which two people or groups of people give each other help and advantages]
sentence: We offer to all our trading partners a commitment to reciprocity and fairness.

translation: rachunek, rachuba [the act of calculating something, especially in a way that is not very exact]
sentence: By my reckoning you still owe me $10.

translation: rozkoszować się czymś [to like or enjoy something]
sentence: I always relish a challenge.

translation: naprawczy [formal]
sentence: Remedial action must be taken now.

translation: odroczenie wykonania wyroku (też: chwilowa ulga) [an official order that stops or delays the punishment, especially by death, of a prisoner]
sentence: The injection provided a temporary reprieve from the pain.

translation: zaradny [skilled at solving problems and making decisions on your own]
sentence: She's a very resourceful manager.

translation: rozmyślać [formal; to think carefully and for a long period about something]
sentence: She ruminated for weeks about whether to tell him or not.

translation: bezinteresowny [caring more for what other people need and want rather than for what you yourself need and want]
sentence: She’s a selfless person who is deeply concerned about social justice.

translation: kazanie
sentence: We had to listen to a long sermon on the evils of wasting time.

translation: niedociągnięcie, wada [a fault or a failure to reach a particular standard]
sentence: Whatever his shortcomings as a husband, he was a good father to his children.

translation: unikać [to avoid something; to ignore someone and not speak to that person because you cannot accept their behavior, beliefs, etc.]
sentence: After the trial he was shunned by friends and family alike.

translation: świństwa, sprośności [magazines, books, pictures, films or jokes that offend some people because they relate to sex]
sentence: There's an awful lot of smut on television these days.

translation: brudny, plugawy [dirty and unpleasant]
sentence: There are lots of really sordid apartments in the city's poorer areas.

translation: mienić się [to shine brightly because of reflected light]
sentence: Her eyes sparkled with excitement.

translation: złośliwy [wanting to annoy, upset, or hurt another person, especially in a small way, because you feel angry towards them]
sentence: That was a spiteful thing to say!

translation: ukrywać, chować na potem [informal; to store or hide something, especially a large amount]
sentence: The stolen pictures were stashed (away) in a warehouse.

translation: pozostawiony samemu sobie (lub: na mieliźnie) [unable to leave somewhere because of a problem such as not having any transport or money]
sentence: He left me stranded in town with no car and no money for a bus.

translation: walczyć, usiłować, starać się [to try very hard to do something or to make something happen, especially for a long time or against difficulties]
sentence: In her writing she strove for a balance between innovation and familiar prose forms.

translation: ściernisko, lekki zarost
sentence: With the back of his hand, he rubbed the stubble on his chin.

translation: duszny [(of a building, room, etc.) warm in an unpleasant way and without enough fresh air]
sentence: It gets very hot and stuffy in here in summer.

translation: szew [a stitch used to sew up a cut in a person's body]
sentence: The syringe was removed, the skull opening sealed with dental cement, and the skin sutured.

translation: przekonać
sentence: He was swayed by what he read

translation: wpadać w zachwyt (też: omdlenie) [to feel a lot of pleasure, love, etc. because of something or someone]
sentence: The audience swooned with delight.

translation: splamić, skazić [to spoil something or give it an unpleasant quality]
sentence: His reputation was permanently tainted by the financial scandal.

translation: zdawkowy [using few words, sometimes in a way that seems rude or unfriendly]
sentence: The President issued a terse statement denying the charges.

translation: przechylić [to (cause to) move into a sloping position]
sentence: He tilted his chair backwards and put his feet up on his desk.

translation: ulewny [used to refer to very heavy rain]
sentence: Torrential rain helped to disperse the large crowd, estimated at 150,000.

translation: chusteczka nawilżana [a small square of wet paper, used especially for cleaning your face and hands with when there is no water available]
sentence: On the plane, the flight attendant brings you a towelette after your meal.

translation: przelotny, przejściowy [formal; lasting for only a short time; temporary]
sentence: A glass of whisky has only a transient warming effect.

translation: parodia [formal]
sentence: Langdale described the court ruling as a travesty of justice.

translation: urwis [a child who behaves badly in a way that is funny rather than serious]
sentence: Come here, you cheeky little tyke!

translation: czuwanie [an act of staying awake, especially at night, in order to be with a person who is very ill or dying, or to make a protest, or to pray]
sentence: His parents kept vigil beside his bed for weeks before he died.
